title: How can I stop interest for a default judgement over 8 years ago.
question: Receive letter from Winn Law Gourp informing $4,773.38 Post Judgement Interest continue to accur at the rate 10% per annum. Can they do this. They have judgement lien on my home.
answers: The interest rate is set by statute. Time to see a bankruptcy attorney to see if you are a good candidate for bankruptcy and a motion to avoid the lien on your real estate.

The answer to your question about interest is: Yes, CA judgments are subject to statutory interest of 10% per year. A judgment can quickly double in size due to interest accumulations. Depending on whether or not you have equity in excess of your statutory exemption amount, your property could be sold by the judgment creditor to pay off the debt. Don't wait on this. Bankruptcy may offer you a solution and allow you to remove the judgment lien and discharge it. Remember, BK is more than checking boxes on forms you find online.
